description:
Convenient Starbucks located inside Wells Fargo. 
Now I can get my coffee while getting my money haha. 

Typically short lines in here, friendly staff & usual Starbucks coffee. Nothing to complain, everything good as it should be. 

*You need to buy a drink to use their bathroom.
author: Yuriy T.

description:
I just left this Starbucks location. While I was in line for less than a minute, the man in front of me asked the cashier for a code to use the bathroom. The (male) cashier informed the potential patron that the bathroom was only for paying customers. 

After what happened at a Starbucks in Philadelphia, PA in April, 2018, I had read in May, 2018 that "no purchase was needed to sit inside a Starbucks location (or on an associated patio) or to use a bathroom." See the following URL: https://www.usatoday.com/story/money/2018/05/20/starbucks-tells-employees-let-anyone-use-bathroom/627003002/

Maybe this Starbucks has a different policy because it's inside a Wells Fargo branch. There's no dividing wall between the coffee shop and where banking services are provided.
author: Sunny T.

description:
No complaints here! We walked in when most people are getting off work. It's housed in with Wells Fargo. It's kind of an interesting setup but I guess it works. You do your banking, then get some coffee! 

Our barista was friendly, drinks came out in a timely manner, and it was right. While drinking our lattes we noticed that no one waited a super long time for their drinks, Nice. I'll gladly come back if I'm in the area.
author: Micki M.

description: As of a week ago, it is announced that no purchase necessary to sit inside it's cafes. So rest easy! I come here often to get my morning breakfast and use the internet. This location is on the corner of 19th & Geary and is inside Wells Fargo Bank. Starbucks never disappoints. Each location I go to is great. Breakfast & Wifi is all I need!
author: Annie L.

description:
Starbucks I have purchased over $1k of products and drinks and ranked top #2 customer at a different Starbucks and then they refused to give me a code treating me like I am a homeless, wtf 

I will call customer service ASAP to voice my concerns about this
author: Connie L.

description:
This is one of the most convenient Starbucks to go to. Especially if you are banking at Wells Fargo at the same time. The barista's are all very friendly and know all the neighbors names. 

Check this place out for a friendly neighborhood feel.
author: Bessie T.

description:
Today, we accidentally spilled the whole drink! Just a few second after we got the drink from the Barista. It was the Chunky Monkey frappichino from the secret menu. But all the Starbucks workers we're so nice. 

I asked the Starbucks worker if I can use a towel and I can clean it myself. They said don't worry. They would clean it. And they even replaced the same drink for us. 

All the Starbucks workers were so nice. I was very apologenic . But they kept saying it's okay. That happens often. 

When we first walked up and gave the cashier the order for the chunky monkey. He was smiling and said "it's my first day and I get this complicated order hahah". But he was playful about it. As complicated as the order was, he was smiling and asked help to take the order. 

After we accidentally spilled the drink,  the person cleaning the drink said "go back to cashier and get a replacement. I felt so bad.  Because when we went back, we did that same exact complicated order to him again. Only this time, he knew exactly what was in it and didn't have to check. Good memory! 

This was the first time we ever spilled Starbucks drink. When we spilled it, both my daughters looked at each other in shock. "Oh no, that was an expensive drink!"  And they later said to me "when we spilled the drink, I was thinking there's still some left in the cup and we can just drink what's left over and leave. But when all the Starbucks workers offered to replace the whole drink, my daughters were all so happy. 

We walked out the door talking about how nice everyone at Starbucks was and how good the drink tasted. 

Usually we just walk in, but the drinks, and walk out.  Never know much about the employees working at Starbucks. But after today, we're fans of Starbucks and especially this location that made us feel so welcome. Thank you Starbucks!
author: Jack L.

description: This review is for a specific barista named LIZZIE. She is extremely rude and unpleasant. She called out my name and put down a hot drink on the table. I asked if she said Kim and she looked at me and said "KIM" with attitude and rolling her eyes. For absolutely no reason. I told her I asked for it iced and instead of apologizing she said ok. She made other drinks before she redid mine and when she handed it to me she said "here". She clearly hates her job so she should quit. She's not cut out for customer service.
author: Kim Y.

description:
Good ole reliable. 

I go to the eye doctor around the corner and ALWAYS arrive too early for the 1st appt of day. Starbucks is my let's hang out and not be awkward place. Order a tea or coffee and sit and wait a bit.

Service is friendly- this location is off. Half band/half Starbucks. Good green tea latte per usual.
author: Amanda M.

description: Can't go wrong every morning with a little pick me up treat! Either it being an iced tea, caffeinated drink, or a little pastry, my neighborhood Starbucks never disappoints. I love that I can easily place my order over the App and pick it up as I pass by before work. It definitely gets quite busy every morning, but the benefits of ordering ahead of time save lots of wait time. I've encountered some instances where I stop by and my order isn't complete, however the Starbucks employees always great me kindly and ask for my name, making sure they finish my order right then and there. One of my all time favorite Starbucks locations! Thanks for all your hard work :D
author: Julia K.

description: Great service. Starbucks is inside the Wells Fargo. Restrooms are coded.
author: S F.

description: Wouldn't recommend this Starbucks unless you prefer waiting at least 20-25 minutes for your mobile order & want to be given an attitude once you finally get it. This location is repeatedly unorganized and chaotic. Today in particular, no one behind the counter seemed to really know what they were doing. The only one who even remotely seemed like she knew what she was doing was Katie, but she had a nasty attitude. I was very polite because I understand they are busy on the weekends and don't mind waiting a little longer as long as the people are friendly. Once my drinks were finally made she told me it would be a few more minutes for the food (warming) items. I said no problem. Eventually the items were tossed in the mobile order section and everyone behind the counter ignored customers who asked if they could check if their mobile orders were ready. While I was waiting I observed SEVERAL people who did not receive certain parts of their order, and when the baristas were questioned, they picked up an empty food item bag and said, "oh yeah, we're out." Hello.. would be nice to know. Once my food order was tossed on the counter and I got Katie's attention she snapped and said very rudely, "NEXT TIME JUST TELL US YOU'RE WAITING FOR A MOBILE ORDER." Hmm that's weird because you handed me my drinks which said "mobile order 2 of 4." And told me the food would be just a few more mins. Lol I'm usually a cash tipper but here's your tip today Katie: if you hate your job, find another one.
author: Allie B.

description: Awful. One of the employees was incredibly rude both to customers, as well as to her coworkers. I like to give people the benefit of the doubt, but this was too much. Probably won't go back to this Starbucks.
author: Dana M.

description:
A funny looking skinny tall lady serving at Starbucks this afternoon refused to give me a code number designated for their customers to use the restroom.  
Her name tag was written so badly that I could not recognize it.  So I asked her gently but she did not say.  When I asked her again, she tersely said Jenny, which was not very audible, and which did not appear to match with her name tag scribbled with a faded long letters.  So I asked her again, but no response.  
After asking 4th time, she said very softly, Zhennya with "Z: in front, like Zebra, which seems to match her look well.  I asked her many times to give me the code, but she either ignored me, or said no.  
Meanwhile I almost lost control over my bladder but barely managed not to urinate in front of her, silently screaming to myself, "Oh crap Ahhhhhhhhhhh-------------!"  What a devil. 
But she seemed to be enjoying, smiling to other customers while occasionally watching my face expression now completely distorted with obvious pain of barely controlling my bladder, shaking and twisting my entire body in front of her.  
Luckily after waiting for 10-12 minutes while standing in front of her, another Starbucks lady came by and gave me the code.  I dashed to the two restrooms, only to find a red "occupied" sign on the front door locks.  What a bummer.  I will never go back to this Starbucks again.  If you see a zebra looking lady there, don't expect any mercy from her.  Run! Run! Run!
author: Michael S.

description: the clerk is very rude, and very impatient, the bad experience. i ordered 2 cup of coffee, one is ready after 15 minutes,one is not ready even after 25 minutes. When i query status, the female clerk are very impatient, even rude throw the hot water bottle to basket of shop, i didn't see such  sevice attitude before.
author: Haiprng L.

description: This is the nicest Starbucks I've been to and try to avoid going to any other. I will only ever go in the morning before work and they always remember my name, which is super sweet. They joke around and sincerely want to make their morning as well as every customer's morning enjoyable. They've only messed up my order once out of all the times I've been there, but I won't even complain because their customer service is the best I've seen for a Starbucks.
author: Marie C.

description:
Gene was absolutely amazing!! I don't understand why this place has bad reviews?! Starbucks in general is great. Yes I get it, never a fan of the prices but the customer makes the experience whole. He was delightful like my latte! I got the ginger bread holiday spice flat white, non-fat, a huge fan already! 

He was witty, energized, and accommodating. He suggested the original coffee cake and was out so I opted for the only option left- Cinnamon coffee cake. Which doesn't taste like coffee at all. He was so sweet enough to comp me for the inconvenience.

Overall, service and drinks were great! Thumbs up
author: Farah A.

description:
Kudos for the Wells Fargo/Starbucks on Geary!  They saved me a lot of time by providing free Wifi to solve my chase dilemma (see Chase review). 

Of course I bought a drink in order to use their services. Staff is nice and drinks were made fast. 

I cannot express the importance of free wifi as an amenity!
author: Wendy H.

description: The staff here is awesome - why am I yelping about Starbucks you've been there already why are you even reading this?
author: Eric S.

description: 11am and no food or drink menu listed. I know some people know the menu inside and out, but it made it difficult to knowing what was being served or what I wanted......
author: Ryan A.

description:
If you know the recipe to what you want, they will make it!

Venti Vanilla Creme Frap (whole milk)
3 shots of caramel
3 shots of toffee nut
whipped cream
caramel drizzle

All of that equals harry potter's butterbeer! How cool! Since I'll probably never make it to the wizarding world of harry potter, this is the closest I'll be able to get! It wasn't crazy too $$$, I think it was around $5.05? Something in that range. Tasted very milky and caramel-y, kind of like sweet vanilla milk. http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/starbucks-coffee-san-francisco-27#XJPCgXVUExvNvpzaqWRA0Q
author: Kylie L.

description: The male barista with dark curly hair in a ponytail with a beard has a bad attitude. First he acted like he didn't know the recipe of an item in the special menu. Then when the cashier didn't ring up my order correctly, instead of apologizing for getting my order wrong since he didn't make it correctly and taking responsibility, he walked away. Bad service, bad attitude, he must hate his job so he needs to be FIRED instead of giving a stink face to customers.
author: Kimberly T.

description: This Starbucks is located inside of Wells Fargo and is pretty spacious with lots of seating. I wanted to write this review because of one barista. I came in today at 4:15ish and met Heather. She's a slender woman with a grey streak of hair down the middle of her head. anyway, she was working at the bar and I noticed she struck up a conversation with everyone that ordered a drink. I used to work at Starbucks and remember it was esp hard for me to do that because you're constantly making drinks. She did it with ease and seemed pretty genuine when I was talking to her I just wanted to give her a 5 star review because of how awesome she is!
author: Kelly S.

description:
I have been to hundreds of Starbucks all over the country through the years, and I'd like to nominate Anthony (hair-flips and all! You are soooooo cool, bro!) as the least helpful/most pretentious barista employed by the company. I made the mistake of returning to this Starbucks with my family after purchasing a more expensive drink earlier to get an iced coffee refill. The girl at the counter apologized and said I could only get a cup discount (.10 really??) and that her manager was a "stickler" and that it had to be the same visit to get a refill. So...leaving for a short time and returning wasn't ok? Whatever.
I wasn't thrilled, but I could deal with that. 

Then Anthony had to "add value" with his douchey, unsolicited and self-satisfied pronouncement that "You wouldn't take a cup back to Denny's and ask for a discount, would you?" 

No one asked you, rockstar!
Although, if Denny's aggressively pushed their rewards program and that was one of its features? Yes. Yes I would. 

I can take comfort in the fact that I could leave and enjoy the rest of my evening, while Outer Richmond Starbucks visitors are stuck dealing with this annoying little asshat. Starbucks management? Stop by and see this smug diva in his element, rudely bellowing to anyone who would listen that the store was closing in 15, 13 and then in nine minutes. Way to make the customers feel welcome, bud! Also, note that I am far from the only customer who was so annoyed by this employee's piss ante attitude that it warranted a posting.
author: J M.

description: These stars are for the guy at the register. Amazing. Remembers everyone's name and what they order. That is true customer service
author: Candice K.

description: I never had such horrible service at any Starbucks before. First off, I didn't come in expecting people to be nice, but I don't need to be felt like shit. It was not busy or anything, so there's really no excuse. Anthony was the one who took my order and I almost just wanted to walk out. Okay, maybe he was having a bad day but why do I deserve to be treated the way I was treated. I ordered a frapp and he asked if that was all with attitude or maybe I took it the wrong way. Okay fine whatever. Then, I went to scan my card but he didn't tell me I was on the wrong scanner til waaaay later. I still felt like he was being mehh, but whatever I was the stupid one. Lastly, I wanted to refill my card since I didn't have enough, but I felt like he was giving me a hard time since he said I should've reloaded before ordering. I get why, but I never had that problem ever. I felt like today was a bad day and maybe I'll just go to another location from now on. Also, a costumer asked to have milk added in their drink and Anthony responded ok....................What kind of milk, I just think he could've handled the situation better. If I was in their shoes, I would've felt like I should've never asked for milk or something. Shoooot, if I knew I was going to feel shitty trying to add money on my card then I would've not even done it! So much for being a gold member... I just felt like I've never had this type of interaction with a Starbucks worker before. In result, not only am I going to try to avoid this location but it makes me think twice about maintaining my gold level. Don't get me wrong, I enjoy Starbucks every now and then but not with that badtitude.
author: Maggie W.

description: This location has its worst and best times whether it is from the service or quality of the drinks. I find myself always getting drinks that are made terribly 85% of the time. Most of the time, the employees here seem miserable, therefore, they show bad service or are not so friendly. Lastly, the staff ALWAYS take their sweet time, even when their is a bunch of orders to take in.
author: Stacey M.

description:
Easily found street parking on Geary street outside this Starbucks even on a long weekend. It is weirdly located inside Wells Fargo Bank and the customers including us were using the bank employees' desk as their tables..lol ;) which made me wonder how the employees are able to work on their sticky desks. Good part though is that they have a restroom, though not very clean. 

I had a Green Tea Frappuccino, which was good but the barista was a clumsy guy who didn't do a clean job of transferring it to the cup. My cup was overflowing with frappuccino and was sticky. Other people in our group had Lattes which they liked. We also got the kids organic fruit mix.
author: Mia C.

description: I've been to this Starbucks multiple times either on a weekday or weekend and they never have cold brew. If you ever want cold brew, don't go to this Starbucks.
author: Edwin N.

description:
I was a long time inhabitant of local, small coffee shops. But my favorite one closed a year and half ago and somehow I found myself at this starbucks one day,  and then I could not stop coming back. I mercilessly torture these people every day with my names -"Fruppet", "Mouche", "Mr. Belvedere", "Mochachino" - and every day they take it all in good humor and even started playing along. Now some of them even name me. "Sorrow", "Mop", "Quaalude".

It's sad when the baristas leave or get rotated out. Over the last year, we've lost a few. But the new ones are always great too. It's like the circle of life, except that sometimes the baristas come back. If you are looking for a real good time, try talking to Walter or Anthony, those guys know how to make a coffee drink AND they totally get "it" ( everything ).

Anyway, the atmosphere here is great. If you come on a Sunday, you can leave little surprises for the bankers to find on Monday, like little love notes or pieces of nice-colored lint. This starbucks is inside of a bank! If you sit here long enough, you might run into the lady who steals all the napkins or the guy who asks for an extra cup and then fills it up with "free" half and half ( give them an inch and they take a mile), or maybe the guy who comes back twice a day with his cup from last year trying to get free refills. It's always entertaining here. Highly recommended!
author: Nick B.

description: Echoing the sentiments of a few other Yelpers, I never thought I would feel compelled to write a review for a Starbucks but this place has the best baristas I have ever encountered in my life. This team is incredibly friendly, warm, and downright hilarious. They genuinely seem to be having a blast at work and their enthusiasm and laughter is contagious. My beverage was crafted to perfection and even enhanced by my talented barista's suggestion. During my time at the location, a group of special needs adults arrived and each was treated with dignity, respect, and care. Locals who came in are treated like old friends - this is the Cheers of Starbucks! They have a brand-new fan in me. I will be back soon and often :)
author: Alison C.

description: Worst barista attitude. I had made a mobile order and after waiting more than 15 minutes decided to ask the cashier about it. The barista coldly snaps at me "I'm making your mobile order. Next time you ask about an order you ask me, not the cashier. He doesn't know anything". Geezuz. I would hate to be his coworker.
author: Tiny H.

description:
Just another Starbucks.  What else can I really say?

Because it's one of the locations that shares space with Wells Fargo Bank (with whom I do bank with), I will admit that sometimes it is convenient and so some stars are earned.

However, there's not so much about this particular Starbucks location that strives for the top with respect to product and service.  If you ask for a latte and don't demand less "foam" then you'll be paying almost $4 for half foam and half beverage of choice.  

I will disclaim that I am not one of the many Starbucks-a-holics that are die hard fans and absolutely loyal to the brand.  So take this review with a grain of salt.

I have no problem paying $4 for a coffee-drink, but it comes with certain expectations (cafe atmosphere, drink-ware, local vs. corporate).  These are just personal standards, though.

Happy caffeine-hunting.
author: Elisha Y.

description: Weird ambience it shares the Wells Fargo space inside space and seeing so many people lounging in the wellsfargo makes me more worried it's not a secure bank here.
author: LBear B.

description:
Welcome to your friendly neighborhood Starbucks in the Richmond District! Living nearby, this is my go-to spot for coffee to survive my 12 hour shifts. I come here so much that the baristas know what I like and my tall iced caramel macchiato is done quick & easy. 

Pay with your Starbucks card on your phone and every 12 drinks, you'll get a free one! 

Parking is not bad. If you can't find parking in front, there's almost always parking in the lot between Geary and Anza. Enter through 18th Ave, but beware, parking is not free until midnight there. One quarter should get you in and out with a nice cup of caffeine.
author: Connie Y.

description: Very fast and efficient service, pleasant and well trained staff, overall one of the best Starbucks in the city
author: Leo S.

description:
In general, I am a big fan of Starbucks. However at this particular location, with the staff who was there at 4 p.m. on Sunday June 8th 2014, I am giving this a 1 star (zero stars would be more appropriate if possible). 

Before getting in line to get our drinks, we tried to use the bathrooms. There was no toilet paper nor towels in the Men's and Women's bathrooms and both were were dirty. When we called attention to this fact to the staff at Starbucks, we were told it's not their problem, since this Starbucks is inside of a bank lobby, and the bank was closed. But it is the designated bathroom for the Starbucks customers. So it really is a Starbucks problem. 

After we brought it to his attention and suggested to him that it really should be Starbucks problem to make sure the bathroom is clean and stocked with toilet paper for their customers, he ordered us to leave the establishment. He said he doesn't have to wait on people who who have an "attitude problem". Because he felt that since we suggested they need to take care of the restroom, we have an attitude not worthy of being their customer. 

I give a strong warning to anyone who wants to patronize this Starbucks location.  I feel that if they don't have sanitary bathrooms, then their employees may not be following proper after restroom sanitation, as required by law.
author: Mike M.

description: This Starbucks is hands down the BEST Starbucks I've ever been to. I go here almost every Sunday and I am constantly greeted by the friendliest staff! Seriously, always makes my day better when I come in here!
author: Marlana P.

description:
Super weird set up! It's half Well's Fargo and half Starbucks. Is it having an identity crisis? Guess if I'm waiting to talk to a banker, I can chill and get a coffee?!

Okay seriously, this is the closest Starbucks to my house, so I sometimes drop by to grab a coffee while running errands. This of course means I normally go late morning on Saturday or Sunday, so it's always super busy! I've never been in and out in less than 5 mins which is kinda annoying when I can be in and out of a Starbucks downtown before work in that amount of time. If they were faster, I probably would have given them 4 stars, but maybe I just go during their rushes?
author: Elena N.

description: Chelsea Fields is the only reason I'm taking a couple minutes to write this review, something I don't normally do. She gets an Overall Exceed Expectations for delivering OUTSTANDING customer service. As a gold-member for nearly a decade, I've been to dozens of Starbucks around the world, and this was by far, my best experience yet.
author: C Z.

description:
Located in a bank lobby!  Iced coffee has some kind of vanilla flavoring added.  Coffee
needs no flavor added to it.  Best to go to Peet's at Geary/16th Avenue.
author: Richard D.

description: Ordered drinks for the whole family as usual but my son's iced soy chai came as a milk chai. He consumed half of it before he noticed. He's allergic to milk. Ended up having to give him an EPI pen and rush to emergency room. Talked to the manager who gave me a refund, but no real apology. It was busy, but Jeez! We've been coming to this Starbucks for 4 years, but I won't be returning.
author: Imershein L.

description:
This place can be packed to the brim during after school hours but the workers here manage to keep up with the demand. 

If you're looking for a nice quiet place to sit around 3-5pm, tough luck because those hours are Starbucks' Frap. Happy Hour. It can get quite loud on here with all the energy high schoolers can put out. Maybe it was just today because it doesn't always happen.

Anyway, This place is a solid place to grab a coffee and relax around the Richmond area.
author: George Z.

description: Anthony is great! I'm not from this area and I work in food and his customer service is great, he knows his customers and is genuinely just a nice guy. This guy deserves a raise
author: Nya M.

description:
Parking is kind of hard to find, and that is usually what I need to find first. 

This location is interesting because it is inside a Wells Fargo bank. Or at least there is no wall between the two. The staff were pretty friendly, told me things I did not know about. Drinks came out pretty fast, then again there was no one waiting.
author: Stephy L.

description:
WTF?

 A Starbucks inside a bank? A  Wells Fargo inside a Coffee Shop? Would you like a mortgage with your Hazelnut Macchiato?

I am confused....but it is a chill place to get caffeine and take in the sights. Comfy Chairs.....weird living room vibe.

Metered parking.
author: David G.

description: Went into Starbucks to get a bag of coffee beans for Valentines Day for my plus one who is a coffee snob. Anthony came from behind the counter and was kind enough to give me an education about coffee beans. I purchased a bag of Guatemalan Beans. We tried one serving of the beans with a pour over technique and it was too dark for our taste. Today I ventured out in the pouring rain to see if they could lend me some assistance. Gene was such a delight!!!! I spoke of my dislike to the initial bean and he suggested the breakfast blend. We made the trade and we look forward to enjoying our coffee. Excellent customer service!!!!! Thank you.
author: Veronica L.

description:
The same old prototypical menu that has yet to change in quality with the times but still have the non existent gonads to raise their prices. The only reason that they seem to have businesses is because of convenience and rather than anything else.

Even their hot chocolate has a grainy and dry throat after taste. And that's probably the third most simplest drink on their menu. Which makes you wonder about the rest of the menu. (-2)

As soon as they bought out LA boulange and I heard rumors of them possibly taking over teavanna, I figured they were too lazy to upgrade their own quality instead of choosing to become a corporate parasite off others.

You can tell or even just see that the quality of pastries and drinks have sunk far below the shipwrecks of pearl harbor....... (-1)

75$ for a inferior quality tumbler than I can find better at Home goods, Daiso or Chinatown?....Jesus you guys are desperate. (-1)

Recommendation: 
Coffee- Peets,philz coffee (much more reasonable $)

Pastries- Coophenhagen in Burlingame
author: Eric C.

description:
Well I dont think you can *uck up Starbucks drinks, so drinks are pretty standard.
Now I was just there and witnessed "the ugly truth" behind personnel relations. The barista snapped at this poor young Asian girl while she was helping him. He was reallyyy rude.
I ordered a nonfat, no-foam latte x2, and on the second one I asked the same barista to actually put some foam on one of them. He said its on top and didnt even bother to put any. Such a ***hole. Unpleasant visit.
author: Natalya V.

description: I'm sitting here working on a group project, drinking my coffee, and listening to my music, and this family of German tourists sits at the table beside me. Next thing I know, one of the workers came up and welcomed them to the country with cookies on the house. The little girls were so happy! What a lovely moment to witness
author: Sierra H.

description: They are best. Always leave with a good mood. I moved to another district and after two month I came back and they still remember me. The staff is the sweetest
author: Liza S.

description:
Rude. Plain and simple. I can only assume the shift supervisor was working the machines. Im a gold card member asking for a refill and he interjects rudely to contradict my experiences. Final straw.

Ive also heard them dehumanize street people they seem objectionable over the times ive come in. Taking my business to Royal Grounds or Peets. Advising family to do the same.

I'm sure this review will get hidden,  but i had to write it.
author: Edward P.

description:
My old buddy from college and I planned to get some work done after a great morning of dim sum and old friends.  We debated on whether to check out one of San Francisco's startup staples or stay put and food coma won out so we planted down at Starbucks.  This Geary location was actually located inside of a bank so it was kind of a weird juxtaposition but in many ways it worked.

I got my usual venti Cafe Vanilla Frap because I needed a pick me up to power through the weekend work day.  With 3 shots of coffee in it, my mistake was enjoying it in the afternoon and I would inevitably pay for it later.  It was exactly as I remembered it, which is exactly how I expected, so that means it was nom.

While it wasn't the best place in the city to GTD, the WiFi was free and reliable and I managed to find an available outlet to plug into.  The service was sort of slow and aloof here though.  This is a hip location for this ubiquitous coffee house, but I will look for something uniquely SF next time for getting stuff done.

Food: 7/10

Service: 6/10

Price: $

Atmosphere: 7/10
author: Joe M.

description: This is a special Starbucks. We have been to so many of them in the neighborhood and this is an awesome place because of Gene (kind of looks like the Rock: skinnier version) and the staff. Thanks for brightening up our morning.
author: Terrence I.

description:
It's a chain, in a bank chain. The product should consistent from place to place, the differences are in delivery.Things I don't like about this Starbucks:

The drink orders take FOREVER to be made. I always get a black ice coffee and consider giving up and lying down on the floor by the time it arrives. 

The milk & sugar station is always trashed and never has what I need, out of napkins, no milk etc. I get that it is busy but come on.

My order has been forgotten or made wrong at least monthly, twice I have been given ice tea instead of coffee. 

It's the closest Starbucks to my house and I avoid it as often as possible.
author: Cec D.

description:
This Starbucks is located inside a Wells Fargo Bank located right on the corner.  We walked in around 2pm on a Saturday and was able to order immediately, since there was no line.  The server was friendly and efficiently processed our order.

We got our drinks but was not able to sit down to enjoy it.  There are about six tables and they were all occupied.  It seems to be a neighborhood hangout place as people in about three of the tables were all talking with each other.

Typical Starbucks, drink-wise, but don't expect to be able to sit down to enjoy it though.
author: Al L.

description: This Starbucks is located inside of a bank. They didn't have change for a $100 bill and told me they could give me change on a gift card or I could stand in line at the bank teller line to break the bill. Really unprofessional and I think they forgot who is paying who here.
author: Adam B.

description:
Probably my favorite Starbucks.

It's large enough for multiple people and yet it's quaint enough for "by yourself time". It's weird because it's inside of a Wells Fargo Bank so on the weekend when the bank is closed, you can still sit in the chairs where the banking customers would sit. In fact, some people sit behind the desk where the computer terminal is and drink their coffee. 

There were some Wells Fargo pony stuffed animals just laying around and I really wanted to just nab one...but alas I did not. If someone wants to nab one for me, that'd be great! haha.

If I were to be a part of the Occupy SF crowd, this is where I'd do it. You could get coffee and tea and sandwiches and still just do your useless "occupying". But anyone from the Occupy camp - please don't take space in this bank because I (and no one else in this neighborhood) want your smelly tents and your habit of public urination and defection in this beloved spot.
author: Julia P.

description:
I almost missed this place, thinking that the space was just for the Wells Fargo that shares the building. It actually is an interesting setup and if you want to stop at the bank and have a latte, it is very convenient.
They were fast and friendly, especially Sawyer, the barista who took my order. It was a very welcoming and pleasant experience and my machiatto was made the way I liked it.
author: Chris W.

description: A fine Starbucks. Shares an area with a bank, so the entrance is a little obscure. They have a limited seating area setup and it was a very open feel.
author: Adamme K.

description:
Starbucks is certainly consistent; but it's gotten better.

In the past, Starbucks lattes would be thin and milky - but the situation has improved in every way. The staff is always receptive to suggestions, and they're happy to brew a thicker drink, if that's your style. It doesn't have quite the same flavor as, say Peets, but they're definitely improved. 

Starbucks no longer serves lifeless scones; now, these and other baked goods are fresher and crisper than many other coffee establishments. Alas, the management has opted away from adding tables - which can be a problem. If there's no table to enjoy my coffee, I'll find someplace else. And that's nearly every day.

This particular Starbucks is a victim of its own success. At around three, a crush of kids from high school fill the place - not exactly a meditative place to drink coffee.
author: Thirsty C.

description:
Located in the Central Richmond district inside a Wells Fargo Bank located right on the corner.  I came yesterday around 5pm. No line. Walked right up.  Other times, I've been here during the morning rush hour and lines way long.  Also I've been here after a nearby school lets out, and it's busy with no tables available.

The nice thing yesterday was the available metered parking spaces right out front.  Else, you can park around the corner in the paid parking lot and walk down.  

As I was the only customer, the barista was quick with my espresso drink.
author: Shirley N.

description: I go here regularly but probably not any more after receiving poor service. I forgot to ask for a water cup which is my mistake, but I didn't expect to be told to wait in a long line again. I understand that it's a beverage as the associate pointed out, and should have been ordered but it is just a cup of water
author: Gabriella B.

description:
I often lament the state of humanity. Some Starbucks baristas are as dumb as dumb can be. Maybe I shouldn't expect a young person in San Francisco to necessarily understand much about information technology. Granted I did not follow the instructions on my phone screen to tell the barista that I had a reward.

After I scanned the QR code three times (the first time I learned you have to tell the barista you have a reward, the second time I learned you have to tell the barista it is a birthday reward - even though the instructions didn't say that - or the system will think it has already expired), I said to the barista that you would think Starbucks would just have the info coded into the QR code. He said it was. After going back and forth another time, I gave up trying to explain it to him.

A year or two ago, I discovered that if in the middle of the night you try to find out what time a Starbucks store will open that morning (such as at 1 am trying to find out if it will open at 6 am), the company website will not have that info. It only had hours for the other six days of the week. With over 21,000 stores (and how many employees?), you would think someone would have noticed that and had it fixed.
author: Richard S.

description: I was expecting better customer service from this store but as soon as I walked up I had to wait for the cashier to finish her conversation about ice cream with her coworker before I could place an order like HELLLLLLLOOOO!?  I'm standing in front of you trying to give you my money. I thought it was rude. My salted caramel mocha tasted weird too.
author: Jessica K.

description: I like coming here in a Sunday because the bank is closed so there is more chairs to sit & relax.
author: Alix J.

description:
Disappointed that I went in today to get a Grande Decaf Coffee Frap and it was like liquid when it was served to me. When I pointed this out, the barista told me it's because the decaf espresso they use is too hot and melts the ice. She offered to remake it for me and I asked if she can make it thicker, I don't want another watery one. She said she can add more ice. 

This time it came out a perfect consistency but had very little flavor. I took it and it was fine but there needed to me more flavoring added to compensate for the extra ice. I don't get what the problem is, I have been ordering this drink all over the state for years and have never had this happen before. But the past 2 times I ordered (here and on Van Ness & California a few days ago) this hap happened. 

I also don't understand why this was served at all..if you know decaf frapps will turn out the wrong consistency, you should stop serving them until you get this issue resolved. I could see it was almost liquid when it was poured in the cup, I know the barista had to have noticed, yet she served it to me like it was normal?? 

The staff there were SUPER nice and friendly, so I really appreciate that, and that is why they earned 3 stars. I just don't understand why they are serving melted frapps to people!? I sent a message into corporate in hopes to get this resolved.
author: Venus S.

description:
Decent location for a Starbucks shop. 
I love going there because it's near my house. Often times its very busy there and I had to wait to get seated but all in all it's a pretty cozy place to grab a coffee and chill around.
author: Yong C.

description: This is the one Starbucks I can always count on to mess up the simplest orders. I don't understand. The worst part is you can see the same guy mess up repeatedly and carry on with a dgaf attitude.
author: Patrick L.

description: The baristas here are cool. Especially Ryan and Todd. Everyone comes here...just walk in, get a blizzard or a sundae. It's great.
author: Andrew C.

description:
Starbucks is like a comfort zone.  It's pretty much the same look and feeling (and coffee) all over the world; and that's  comforting.
Plus I do like their offerings.
This particular Starbucks inhabits 1/4 of a Wells Fargo Bank which is a little bit odd.
The staff has also taken on the stiff personality of a bank.  I found them to be the least friendly Starbucks staff I've ever encountered, here or abroad.
Have to say 'thumbs down' on this one.
author: John G.

description: Brit wouldn't get me a glass of water when I had already ordered two sandwiches and a coffee. Being very stand offish by the request to add it on to my already purchased order. Water doesn't cost anything at Starbucks it shouldn't need a new order!
author: Andrew W.

description: I haven't personally had any bad customer service experiences here, but I can tell what baristas the other reviewers are talking about in their reviews, haha. I go here a few times a week, most of them know my order.  The only thing I would change about this place is that there are a lot of sketchy people who hang around the area. It is not Starbucks's fault that Geary can be a little rough, but sometimes guys on bath salts or flakka or whatever people are into these days come in and loiter.
author: Nancy D.

description:
I stopped by here last week after a bowl of Pho Ga from Turtle Tower. Indeed, this Starbucks is situated inside Wells Fargo Bank. What a nice arrangement for both businesses. ATMing and Starbucking under one roof.

I purchased an ice-coffee with milk.
The cash-register gal and the barista-dudette were nice and pleasant [they smiled easily]. There was not a lot of seats, but I snagged one near the register.

Maybe Saigon Sandwich can go in for the perfect trifecta: (1) ATMing for cash, (2) noshing on a juicy grilled pork banh-mi sammie, and (3) sipping on a coffee beverage of your choice.

...Good experience that day.
...I'm gonna give it a 3.5 star rating, yo!
author: Derek N.

description: Bad Starbucks. I usually come here for regular tall cup of coffee and I order about 4 or more for coworkers. I ask for a tiny cup all the time so I can fill it up with cream and usually it's free. This is the first time that they started charging 2 bucks just for the cup for cream. Reason I even put it in the cup is because once I get back to my coworkers and I put cream in for them it gets cold before they can even add sugar. Next time I know but they can kiss my @ss....
author: Andy Y.

description: I don't know what's going on here. Six employees on the floor but yet it took 15 minutes to get a bagel. Usually when you finish a transaction you should have what I ordered. They didn't and told me after I was rung up. The wait for a different bagel was just exhausting. I could see other customers getting annoyed as well. This isn't the first time this has happened, waiting this long at this location. It's no wonder this Starbucks has a three star average on Yelp. I think that's pretty generous honestly.
author: Rob B.

description: I'm come in here every morning after dropping my daughter off at daycare. Service is smooth and relatively quick plus they've become familiar with me so most of them know the drink i'm ordering
author: Keith A.

description: I usually order a medium iced coffee and I did so this time in the afternoon on 3/21/15. Normally they give you the iced coffee right at the register but I waited patiently for my coffee. There was one barista working so the wait was a little longer than usual. Seemed like the other workers were new or was reorganizing the store. I was totally fine with the wait, but when I got my coffee.. (Finally) I noticed that she had added sweetener to my plain ice coffee. So I asked her what she put in it politely. Then she sarcastically said there is sugar in it. I looked at her dazed and confused because everyone I order an iced coffee there is never any sweetener! Then I proceeded to tell her my past experience with the order.. And she aggressively said well there is sweetener in it unless you told the cashier you didn't want it. I said ummm okay. What she did next ticked me off even more, she just walked away! She didn't even offer me a new drink!! I tried to get her name but he name tag is written in Japanese. She also has glasses, and a couple of tattoos on her arm. I don't know when this Starbucks for this bad. It was obviously not her day and she should have taken a day off! Ridiculous!
author: Jessica T.

description: This Starbucks is amazing.  Very friendly and sociable staff, and they even used a shaker for my green tea latte (many starbucks refuse to do this even if you ask) without me asking them to!  Will be here a lot more than my previous usual location.
author: Tim L.

description: This place is home. I'm here almost everyday meeting my boyfriend. The other customers most of the time are very nice and the staff is always really nice too. They know my boyfriend by name and drink since he's there almost twice a day everyday and orders the same thing. It's always clean and always has a comfortable place to sit. I give it two thumbs up!!!
author: Faith M.

description:
This place is great.  Nice staff.  One night, my boyfriend and I got some drinks and little pastries, and then the guy offered to give us all of the other pastries that they were going to throw out in a couple hours.  How nice!!!  Good thing they were gonna throw them out - they were getting on the stale side.  But that was very nice of them.

The only thing about this place is that there is always a line and it always takes forever to get your drink.
author: Jill B.

description: Nasty manager at Starbucks on Geary and 19th Ave. I was stopping by to wait for a friend inside this Starbucks. The manager who is about 5'5", skinny built, white with dark hair, glasses, came by and told me they are closing and she emphasized 'in a minute'. I looked at the time; it was only 8:53pm. And I knew this Starbucks close at 9pm because I am a regular customer too. She just want to kick me out. After I walked out and waited for my friend outside. I saw a customer walked in and of course this manager served the customer and did the transaction. SHAME on her to treat the neighborhood customer like this!!!!  SHAME on Starbucks to have such unfriendly manager/staff!!!! I'll go to peet's or another Starbucks from now on instead.
author: Xo X.

description:
It's Starbucks. In a bank. Wellsbucks? Stargo? Cash your checks while you wait for your latte. Go to the ATM before you spend five bucks on a frappe. The bank isn't all that big, and yet the seating area feels oddly like a food court. I feel sorry for the tellers here, the noise must drive them crazy.

I'm in here every now and then when I feel up to a morning stroll. For some reason, the clientele here loves to leave the tables in a mess. Wrappers, napkins, newspapers, wooden stirs. Anyway, if you want to kill two birds with one stone, this is an ideal location for maximum efficiency.
author: Tony L.

description:
This particular Starbucks is most excellent. Aside from the establishment being a hybrid of bank and coffee (wells fargo + starbux), the customer service here is top notch. Today, when i came in here in order to pick up a sweet, winter-flavored peppermint white chocolate mocha as a surprise for my girlfriend, i found out that they ran out of peppermint everything! bummer. just as i was about to say "Thanks, but no thanks. i only want peppermint everything" the nice associate offered me a free drink as an apology for not having peppermint in stock. I ended up getting a free medium caramel machiato. the worker was very friendly and almost jolly in making my drink, filling it all the way to the brim before lidding it up in a tightly sealed container. I was thoroughly impressed by the customer appreciation. the coffee itself was very good, and well-made. 5 stars

-wifive-
author: simon k.

description: The employees at this Starbucks are among the rudest I've encountered, and I go to Starbucks everyday. There is a woman with a shaved head and tattoos working there that was so awful to me when I asked for more milk in my drink. I paid $3 for a crappy drink because she refused to give me the amount of milk I wanted in my drink. Terrible customer service.
author: Lauren C.

description:
I come here at least 3 mornings a week. Every time I leave with a smile. The staffs were super nice. I like how the cashier (i assume she's in training cuz she wears white shirt instead of green) remembers my name. And how the barista makes jokes and are super nice to me when they hand me my drinks.
Drinks are great, and the fact that it's inside wells fargo banks makes it even more interesting. Nice view, nice people, but i took out 1 star cuz the wifi isnt free. Thats the only negative thing to me
author: Alan T.

description: This location can get REALLY busy.  It is in the lobby of Wells Fargo, so I'm sure the employees love the smell of coffee all day long.  Or maybe they hate it?  Anyway, the tables are reasonably comfortable, but there aren't many outlets to plug in your laptop.  Plan ahead and bring an extension cord.  Parking isn't too crazy in the nearby residential neighborhood (better than paying for parking on the street), but hey, it's San Francisco, so it won't be easy either.  In an area with few alternatives, it's a good place to get some work done, but it's certainly not a place I'd like to hang around for an extended amount of time.
author: John S.

description:
I like Starbucks.  Sometimes I get sick of it, and I go to other cafes.  Peets has damn good coffee, no doubt about it.  And Philz is off the hook.  However, none of those franchises, is near the outer richmond.  Sure, i could go up to Laurel Village to the Starbucks or Peets there, or across the park to, or to any of the mom and pop cafes with free wifi in the area.  I could, and sometimes I do.  I'm a huge fan of Java Beach for example.

Today, though, I found myself in this particular starbucks.  Don't hate and get over it.  I like Starbucks.  Unfortunately my experience today was less than stellar.  It wasn't the service.  Every time I've gone here the service is great.  The barristas are always more than happy to make whatever whimsical drink i come up with.  Usually though it's a skinny latte with two splenda.  Like you care.

The big problem with this particular store is the music.  They share a space with Wells Fargo which is extremely convenient.  What is inconvenient is that apparently the barristas don't have access to the music system.  So when Starbucks is pushing their new disco album, that is what plays on the speakers above my head.  Do you know how hard it is to job search with the Bee Gees singing Night Fever Night Fever.  I can't even make follow up phone calls without worrying about the shrill falsetto of one of the Gibbs brothers above me.  

It is especially nice when the disco music is accompanied by a crying baby and two older gentlemen yelling into a phone IN CHINESE!  I'll be the first to admit I've made phone calls in cafes, and I'm sure my voice carries, but this was overwhelming even for me.  Oh, and did I mention the multiple lap dogs running around, their little nails skritching the tile floor and weaving their leashes in and out setting up some sort of canine viet cong trip wire system.  

So, why don't I just leave?  You know, that's a good idea.  Maybe I will.   They get three stars.  One for service.  One for convenience and one because there is usually always an open table and outlet for the computer.
author: Adam E.

description: I used to frequent this location a lot since I enjoy the staff. Today I mobile ordered when I was a block away, thinking I could just swoop in and get my drink and continue on with my day. I walk in, and it wasn't ready yet, so I just hung out for a sec. I watched the dude on bar wipe the same spot on the counter for a minute or two. Then he wiped under the mobile order receipt printer, with the ticket sticking out. Did he make the drink? No. There was no one in line, and no other drinks to be made. He continued wiping things down for another minute or two, then called to a girl who was grinding beans that there was a mobile order. Did he even look at the ticket, or make the drink, or really do anything remotely productive to expedite the order? No. After a while, he strolled over to the sticker machine, stickered my drink, stickered another drink, and lazily made my tea order. He didn't shake it, but instead just poured it between two cups. Then he set it on the counter, without a lid for some reason. Made a frappuccino. Started a latte. And there my tea sat, without a lid for FIFTEEN MINUTES. Honestly it was so ridiculously slow I thought I was being punk'd. Don't come here unless you want to wait fifteen minutes for an incorrectly made order when there are no other drinks in line.
author: k h.

description: Most Starbucks have cheerful employees. Like this one. It just felt nice. When the employee said hi what what would you like? (with a smile) okay thank you (your name here).
author: M L.

description:
This has to be one of the weirdest feeling Starbucks on Sundays.

It shares the space withe Wells Fargo, but the bank is closed on Sunday. You'll see people wandering around the bank, sitting in the dark at bankers desks, drinking coffee. It's like the apocalypse happened and the survivors have decided to get some burnt joe.
author: Nik D.

description:
OK, I'm a Peets-is-better-than-Starbucks girl. That said, Starbucks is close enough to my office to grab an oatmeal and sometimes a coffee and it's negligible if the extra 3 blocks to walk to Peet's is worth it sometimes. 

I love how they'll comp you the flavoring if you pay with a *registered* SB card (it also gives me 2 hrs free wi-fi). I think this location is comfortable to sit at for a few minutes and they do have some (always taken) arm chairs.
author: Kira B.

description: This is a half Starbucks half Wells Fargo bank on Geary.I know I have never seen this before either. It is a small place with several tables. The service is pretty good. The place was packed. It is a good place to get your banking and a cup of joe. Bathrooms are shared with the bank and in the bank area but not great as a stand alone bathroom for either place. If it is out of towels, as it was on my visit, you aren't sure who to tell. Men going in the women's bathroom even when they could have waited. Strange. The drinks were ok. Out of items but this place gets the weekend traffic.   Definitely an atypical Starbuck's vibe. If you are a coffee loving Wells Fargo banking don't mind meter reading person this place might become a fav.
author: H D.

description: Came here to order a couple of drinks with the lady.  Restroom was completely out of paper.  When we ordered drinks, barista broke two cups and splashed coffee all over herself, the counter and the floor.  On her third attempt, the cup didn't break but there was a mess and she wiped the coffee off the cup with a soggy rag.  And when we politely asked for a lid, she replied very sarcastically.  Hmm.. we weren't rushing her or anything... Talked to the manager on the side, he gave the typical, "sorry, but have a nice day" line with no sincerity.
author: V N.

description: I haven't necessarily had a poor experience here minus the fact that it seems like they never seem to hear the "light ice" part when I order my iced coffee. Other than that, the baristas never gave me any trouble, nor do I give them trouble with ridiculously long orders, so it's a pretty good location. Conveniently located across the street from Gordos, which is great after that mexican food food coma. Also near multiple banks, grocery stores, and Walgreens. The seating inside is extremely limited since they share the floor with Wells Fargo.
author: Jessica L.

description:
I like this Starbucks after 6 pm without all the banking traffic. It's a nice place to sit and watch Geary go by.

The coffee is really good, that is the main draw. Also the leather chairs are comfortable.

Not an especially hang out type of place, more a grab your coffee and go.

They have SB gift cards, who doesn't like that?

You know, I tried being a non-corporate-support my neighborhood type of person but the coffee was rank, so much so that I poured it down the gutter and spent another $5 at SB. 

So now I just go straight there, because the coffee is consistent.
author: Sharon J.

description:
I've come here religiously for over 6 years. 

I love the corporate yet personal feel. I love the drinks. I love the size. I love the temperature. I love the Wi-Fi. I love the remodeling job. I love to see--but not usually to speak with--the regulars. 

I LOVE that my bank is next door. 

I'm sad that, recently, the staff drastically changed.
author: Paulina F.

description:
i used to hate hate hate this place.  my husband however needs his coffee, and likes the consistency and swiftness of this starbucks over the peets up the street, so, even with the crazy racist lady experience, (see my old review.  It's infuriating!) i have gone in.  The staff has really taken a turn for the up and up lately, because i have fallen in love with many of the sweet gals and guys.  they are always happy to see us, and treat us like VIPs.  they have won me over.   i feel like i want to work there, to be honest with you.  full benefits for pt?! holla!  
thanks for reading.
author: yayoi s.

description: So, this sbux is in a bank, literally.  I located this one on my phone while in SF, and when I walked in I has to laugh.  Since it was a Sunday and the bank portion was closed, people were sitting at the bankers desks like it was no big deal.  I hope the workers don't clean them off, because I like to imagine the bankers coming in on Monday morning all angry, because somebody's apple fritter crumbs were left all over their ledgers.  Check it out for this alone.  Friendly workers, plenty of seating, I could relax at this sbux.
author: Mike K.

description:
Why am I reviewing the man? Because, I always ask myself the wonderfully philosophical question when passing this place by:

Is it a Starbucks inside of a Wells Fargo, or a Wells Fargo inside of Starbucks. 

Ok..maybe not as thought provoking as "which came first, the chicken or the egg" 

All in all, I'd rather walk another block and get my Green Tea Latte at Peets and support SF
author: Hailey P.

description:
Yuck. Little black bugs crawling on the brownies.
When I pointed it out to the cashier, his response was "so I guess you don't want to buy one?" Got that right. And I won't be back.
author: Mary C.

description: Friendly staff, same old starbucks products, but it's alittle weird that the space is shared with a Wells Fargo bank... besides that nothing wrong with it!
author: Kevin L.

description: Ok everyone listen up the working crew at this location is racist and discriminates against disabled people, gays, and latinos. I could not believe what i saw there. The fat girl behind the counter with glasses on is the rudest person there and asked me to leave while i had a service dog with me.called me faggot and their manager has done nothing about it. On top of it would not serve my friend because he was latino. I have written to a few agencies about this location its dirty and the staff is totally different from what it use to be. If you like animals and dont discriminate, then we should boycott this location till they get rid of the staff.
author: samuel p.

description: This location is always super slow.  Even having 2-3 people in front of you in line means you will wait at least 5 minutes.  I guess I'm used to the downtown locations who are superstars about getting you in and out -- but if I walk up to the store and there are more than 4 people in line, I just skip it since my entire coffee break would be spent getting the coffee.   They also screw up orders fairly constantly.   It is not kept very clean either.  There are always flies buzzing around (and usually some flies trapped inside the bakery case, touching down on the pastries); they are not very quite to clean up spills; and the tables are usually a mess.   Upside? The staff are very sweet.... it's just not a very good store!
author: Heidi M.

description:
I could take or leave Starbucks. I don't seek it out, but if it's the only thing around, I'll drink it. I actually think Peet's coffee is stronger and tastes better. 

But the reason I'm Yelping is because this Starbucks is in a WELLS FARGO BANK! It's the best espresso experience of your life. Imagine this: you walk inside this extremely large store that has a Starbucks logo on the side as you think to yourself "well, I'm in the Outer Richmond, maybe this is the only one around for 3 miles." 

Directly in front of you are cash tellers surrounded by murals of purples and oranges. To the right you'll view the bank people who get desks (most likely to deal with loans). 

To the left: Starbucks! 

The best is on Sunday when the bank is closed, the entire store is empty except for the front left corner. 

My experience here has actually been good. I've had REALLY good customer service and witnessed the baristas deal with some difficult customers quite well. The line always moves rather quickly and there are a few prime-time seats near the window if you're lucky enough to grab one. 

Oh, and after you order your vanilla latte, you can take three steps and get a mortgage on your home.
author: Jared S.

description: Oh so good I never have to worry about not have money for my coffee. I go get coffee and then get my money from teller. Or if I no see line I get money then go get coffee.
author: Elizaveta C.

description: I have been going to this store for many years really just because it is near where I live. It's a convenient location, that's it. Wouldn't recommend otherwise. Though it's worth mentioning that some of the staff are very friendly. It's a busy store with people coming and going. Last time I was there I received a very stern warning about getting a refill, watch out! :)
author: L. A.

description:
This place is decent. It is connected to a bank so it cant be open late. There aren't any coffee shops open late in the Richmond. But if you want Starbucks you have to look for parking and usually there isn't much on the street so usually you have to pay at a meter. The service is normal, nothing special about it. The drinks are sometimes made wrong. They put a lot of ice in the iced drinks. There are usually lines too when its busy.

Pros: The only other Starbucks that isn't on California. 
Cons: Not open late, drinks sometimes made wrong, Hard to find parking. Sometimes lines.
author: David L.

description:
Brilliant:  A large corporate whoring coffee chain inside of another large corporate whoring bank.

And the orange mocha SUCKED ASS. 

It didn't even taste like they put a shot of espresso in it. And the orange flavoring tasted like some bad metallic chemical orange squeezings from some mutant orange from Chernobyl or that grease hand cleaner.

I generally have a hefty hatred for this chain for the bully techniques they use in opening up their businesses near Mom/Pop established coffee shops in smaller towns and do not give these bastards money. But, my two old aunties wanted a shot in the middle of our grocery shopping spree on a Saturday so what's a Starbucks-hater to do?
Their mocha's still SUCK ASS.

And why are there 158 Starbucks locations in SF alone??? Cripes....enough!
author: Barb B.

description:
I like this Starbucks, damnit.

Sure, it's in a bank.  But there are Starbucks in banks, airports, Targets, Safeways... C'mon people, get with the program, this is a perfectly acceptable setting for a Starbucks.

They've got a decent amount of seating, good windows for people-watching and they sell me the kid's size hot chocolate when I don't actually want coffee but am freezing and need something to warm up.  When I am too A.D.D. to have the discipline to get my work done at home I pack up the laptop and head down here because there's something about being in Starbucks doing work that makes me extra efficient.   Maybe it's the speed with which orders are taken and made and the flow of people in and out of there (more than normal because, remember, this is also in a bank) and the general sense of urgency people have concerning serious matters like money and daily caffination. Yes, that must be it.  They get bonus points for magically creating an atmosphere of super-efficiency.  Well, honestly atmosphere is probably only part of it, I'm sure the 5 shots of espresso probably help with that also.

Oh and let's not forget proximity: Super-extra bonus points for being 4 blocks from my apartment!
author: Courtney N.

description:
Their coffee is fine, I mean, Starbucks has standards that make their products very consistent. I'm giving this store a one-star because of their awful customer service skills. Part of getting a job at Starbucks as a barista involves being nice, polite, and friendly to people, I thought. At this location, I've seen a manager dress-down an employee right in front of me. When I'm being handed my coffee, I say thank you, and the barista does not look at me at all but instead asks their coworker if they saw that one thing on tv last night....
hey, we can see and hear you behind the counter. It isn't as if we don't exist standing RIGHT THERE IN FRONT OF YOU. 

Customers deserve better, and not just ones who are your friend coming in to say hi. Given the long wait in lines and the crowdedness at the milk and napkin stand, give this place a pass and try one of the many local places very near such as JavaCat , Royal Ground, or even Pete's.
author: Miss H.

description:
I'm certainly not against sticking coffee places inside other places, but this one just doesn't feel right to me.  Perhaps it was the starbuck's customers who opted to sit at some of the wells fargo desks to enjoy their lattes or what-have-you.  If that was my workspace, I wouldn't want random people perched at my desk with their corn-syrupy concoctions just b/c I had the day off. 

It seemed a bit chaotic inside this bank/coffee house, but that could've been my own mind's feeble attempt at recovery from the night before.  Too. Many. Cocktails.

Of course, my latte here tasted like every other latte I've had at a starbucks.  Service was quick.
author: Meg W.

description:
I would give this Starbucks the full five-star treatment, if they weren't inside of a bank.  It's semi-disturbing to be in a Starbucks, yet just a few feet away people are banking.  The staff here was extremely nice and accommodating.  They also were constantly cleaning up the cafe area whenever there was a lull in the queue: wiping down table, restocking service areas, resetting table and chairs, etc.  

I would come here again, but mainly because it's seemingly hard to find a good Starbucks on this side of SF for some reason.

*WiFi hotspot (TMobile)
*Oven-warmed food
*iTunes WiFi Music Store
(Inside Wells Fargo Bank)
author: Brent A.

description:
Dammit People. Dammit. Why do I love Starbucks, I don't even use Wells Fargo and I still love this. I love the shocking cleanliness, I love the corporate blandness, I love that every drink I've ever gotten here is exactly the same kind of mediocre. I hate myself. I'm sub-human, I've been lying for years!

Starbucks, you win.
author: Tyler W.

description:
The good: No Complaints, Looks just like any other starbucks I've been to. Didnt drickk here but my sis got some coffee and I was with her. 

four stars for being adequate minis 1 for not being outstanding.
author: Keit K.

description: They are consistent, professional, friendly and fast. Park in the back lot most AM's, to avoid $70 cups of coffee.
author: William R.

description: I'm going to go out on a limb and say this starbucks is probably one of the least pretentious locations in the city. Sure it's located in a bank and it seems bizarre to me too, but it works. I've hit the morning rush here and even with all the work people waiting in line and then making their drinks, i'm in & out of here pretty quick.
author: Chrissy L.

description:
Dear Mr. Howard "Starbucks" Schultz,

First of all, I must confess that I am a huge fan of yours. Second, there are a few things that you should know before opening in Italy - you will probably find most of the following tips rather banal, but I will share them with you anyway because I believe in narcissism, participation, and coffee beans.

I am aware that you had an epiphany in Milan, back in 1982, or so the story goes. Apparently, you marveled at the atmosphere you encountered within the espresso bars and decided to replicate it in the US. Well, it worked great, didn't it?

Actually, you did much more than that. You created a brand new world, a new language, and new social rituals. Now Starbucks is a media empire, not just a chain of coffee houses. You have many detractors, especially in Europe, but I am not one of them. I am writing this letter as an encouragement to enter the Italian market as soon as possible and start a Frappuccino revolution.

Now, I am aware that Italy is a very complicated market. Ultra-protected by unfair anti-free market laws, powerful trade unions, cryptic bureaucracy designed to discourage even the more energetic foreign investor... Italy can be a scary place. In addition to legal issues there are some cultural aspects that you should bear in mind: Italians are extremely conservative and close-minded when it comes to edible things. No, really. They are extremely proud of their food culture and quick to label as "blasphemous" every attempt to deviate even slightly from the Canon (read some comments just to get an idea). For instance, If you dare ordering a cappuccino in a restaurant while enjoying your meal you will get incinerating looks from your waiter. 

Even though this behavior is clearly provincial, and ultimately inappropriate, it is the widely accepted, even encouraged - for more information about this, check Stanley Tucci's "Big Night" (1996). It's the same with soccer and fashion: it is just impossible to have a rational conversation with an Italian on these topics. Just smile and move on. As a side note, on average, Italians are old. Otherwise said, the country is ruled by old farts. And old farts are reluctant to try new things, think different, and experiment. 

That is, selling a tall banana douche latte to a 65+ year old might be tough. However, Starbucks should have a bigger appeal on local hipsters, tweens, and young cosmopolitans. More and more Italians are traveling abroad, thanks to low-fare flights, the strength of the Euro currency, international school exchange programs and pervasive ennui. Unlike the Old Guard, the new wave is willing to try new things instead of criticizing a priori what does not conform to the predictability of the so-called culturally imposed "Traditions" (mangia! mangia!). 

Most Italians have not ever experienced the coffee house culture that flourished in most civilized countries, from Austria to the US, from the UK to Germany, from Scandinavia to Central Europe (that's why we emigrated). Ray Oldenburg is a stranger here.

In Italy, coffee is mostly consumed quickly, standing up like a horse, while other customers push you from behind to reach for the sugar, the milk, and other amenities (the idea that these goods could be shared, on a separate table, is unthinkable - sugar, water and coffee, like the Bible, should be chained and restricted from public consumption). Coffee is just a quick boost, and the experience of consuming the drink is not pleasurable per se. Vice versa, Stabucks mainly sells pleasurable - not cursory - experiences, using coffee as a pretext. There is a huge difference. Can you pass the nutmeg? Thanks!

As an addendum, most Italians are willing to pay for the drink, but not for the experience. That is: they mostly care more about the quality of the coffee itself than the contextual elements (ambiance, music, people, relaxing atmosphere, books etc). The truth is that most are not even aware of anything that surrounds the coffee cup - otherwise they would flee the idiotic bars that plague the country. As you did in the US, you will need to teach the customers the new rules of the game. Brainwashing is strongly recommended. You need to erase decades of bad habits and Italians are notoriously recalcitrant. Take something banal like the notion of a queue. Italians are, by definition, anarchic and insubordinate. They simply won't stay in line. 

They do not play by the rules. "Rule" is a foreign concept. They would do anything to disrupt what is politely accepted almost everywhere else - thus, you will need to emphasize signs like "please wait here", "please order here" etc. I would personally recommend the use of in-store electrified fences. Before launching Stabucks Italy you should know that crowd management is sorely lacking in this country! 

Good luck, Mr. Howard "Starbucks" Schultz!
author: Matt B.

description:
*Horrible customer service

*Freakin' racist when some of the workers themselves are immigrants.

*Frapps are different prepared by diff ppl.  When told them that I've been having it from here or anyother starbucks cafe but with same taste, they deny that it's not what it has or made. 

*another short lady w/black hair - fire her man. simply rude. pls don't work here if don't want to. you are not doing us any favor.

Am so returning back to my Peet's! Support Sf!
author: M S.

description: I was gonna give this place a 5 star but the nightmare of having WHIP CREAM on everything i order even though i specifically said NO WHIP still haunts me.. oh! the horror. Its not like i've been there once or twice, or remind them once or.. err twice that i dont want whip with my frap or hot mocha, still it finds its way on my drink. The whip somehow magically appears on my drink, it's like david blaine was magically "whipping" my drink. Guys next time for the love of mankind NO WHIP ON MY DRINK
author: Eddie 'bhong' V.

description: This Starbucks has cockroaches in the espresso machine, yes it's no joke. I have a friend who works at a starbucks at a different location and they warned me not to go there anymore. I stopped going because I thought the service wasn't on par with other Starbucks. Back to the point they apparently cleaned out the machine and got rid of the pests... but people.. come on, you know how bad it has to get for them to find COCKROACHES in the espresso makers?! I won't be going here anymore, that's for sure.
author: Joshua L.

description: Headed out to this Starbucks today as a dual trip--get quarters for laundry and get coffee for studying. Bingo! It was super quick, and as there is 30 minute metered parking just to the side of it, parking was (and usually is) easy! Husband went to get coffees (2 venti iced coffees sweetened, please) and they got the order right, the first time! Yay! And, I was able to go get quarters in the time that they made our drinks. It was great, efficient, and delicious. I'm sure it helps that I bank at Wells Fargo, but hey... it works out nice for me!
author: Bridgette A.

description:
Only slightly less creepy than the Inner Sunset Starbuck's (you know, the one where smiles go to die), this "coffee house" is located within a bank. Yes! A bank! My bank,Wells Fargo, to be exact. Want a little coffee with that money? This branch has got you covered! Looking to celebrate that new home loan? Try a Venti Mocha Frappuccino Light (hold the whip)! 
Seriously: Who decided that putting Starbuck's in Wells Fargos the city over would be such a brilliant  idea? It's working for them. The place is always packed. The barristas keep the line moving pretty efficiently and they have yet to screw up one of my impossible-to-remember orders. Minus one point for the "diverse" array of folks (think homeless guy trying to score my calculator when I wasn't looking) and minus one point for the crowds. BIG points for fast friendly service, a big desk I can study at, big clean bathrooms, and my money...all under one roof.
author: Autumn K.

description: I have one story to tell about this Starbucks, located inside a WF bank. I was in line, waiting to buy some beans, and I noticed several large bugs crawling on the cookies inside the glass food case. I kindly said to the lady, even using my quite voice, "I think that you should remove those cookies--there are lots of bugs crawling on them." To which she replied, "It's okay, the health department allows so many bugs to crawl on them before they consider the food contaminated." Either she's making this up, or the SF Health Department is the worst in the country.
author: Catherine P.

description: Its a freakin StarBucks, what did you expect?! Heh heh, fast service and you know EXACTLY what you are going to get. Oh yeah, this one has a bank in it. Grab a latte and people watch or web surf.
author: Degustator J.

description:
no, not just because its a Starbucks. not because it's part of an evil commercial company bent on destroying privately owned shops, and turning the populace into trend crazed automatons. no, no, that is not the source of the lone star up there.

the place is hooked up to a Wells Fargo - nothing against the Fargo, I'm one of their patrons, but when you walk in there is a dizzying effect of confusion and sense of alien cavern dread. it's as if the forces of capitalism had a meeting, and devised the ultimate trap for your local 20 some odd cubicle dweller - yes, you might be the wrong prey, but the sharp pointy teeth are blind to such facts.

aside from this horror of a scenario, the lines are long, there is no seating inside, the drinks are weak and/or burnt, and in addition to any espresso they put in your drink, they add a shot of evil for free.
author: Darrell L.

description: very nice staff, consistent drinks and food.  if they don't get it right, just tell them, and they'll gladly remake if for you.  the only think is sometimes you get strange ppl that bring other food in and stay forever, taking up tables.  the staff usually lets people bring outside food in, and they don't say anything, so that happens.  but if you're just getting to-go, then it's great.
author: Jen T.

description: i love coming to this starbucks.. since its only a couple blocks away from work.. and it doesnt hurt that the people are so nice here!
author: JUDY L.

description: First of all, I'd like to respond to Joshua's rating. He needs to re-evaluate his sources because there has never been an incidence with cockroaches at this Starbucks. That is complete fabrication and ridiculous. Second, I'd like to say that the employees here would never intentionally be rude to a customer. Therefore, if someone had a bad experience, it was probably because they were rude in the first place! I have nothing but amazing things to say about the baristas at this location. They are always so friendly and try their hardest to make all their customers feel welcome. And of course, the coffee is delicious!
author: Nicole C.
